predefined_profiles.name: Deng Deng
predefined_profiles.public profile: A Dark Zone Breakout game player. This time, with three teammates, they've chosen the military port area on the map to execute a breakout. Deng Deng is a cautious and competitive player.
predefined_profiles.goal: To survive in the Dark Zone, gather as many resources as possible, and successfully evacuate in the end.
predefined_profiles.private profile: Deng Deng wants to be the top player in team operations.

predefined_profiles.name: Iron Hero
predefined_profiles.public profile: A Dark Zone Breakout game player, and a teammate of Deng Deng, characterized by a carefree, rash, and excited personality.
predefined_profiles.goal: To survive in the Dark Zone, collect as many resources as possible, and successfully evacuate in the end.
predefined_profiles.private profile: Iron Hero wants to loot as many bags as possible, including those of teammates.

scenario: At the start of the game, the team is fortunately spawned at the 'Number One Spot' restaurant on the game map. This spawn point has strategic advantages, providing better survival and combat opportunities in this game. Deng Deng and his teammates, positioned at One, Two, and Three, quickly assemble their gear and prepare for battle, all quite satisfied with their spawn point.

profile.name: Machine Blade
profile.public profile: Dark Zone Breakout game player, second teammate of Deng Deng, Machine Blade is a skilled gamer, playing conservatively and calmly.
profile.private profile: Machine Blade aims to continuously rank up and improve his gaming skills.
profile.goal: Survive in the Dark Zone and collect as many resources as possible before successfully evacuating.

profile.name: Invincible
profile.public profile: Dark Zone Breakout game player, a gaming rival of Deng Deng.
profile.goal: Survive in the Dark Zone and collect as many resources as possible before successfully evacuating.

profile.name: Ice Fire Man
profile.public profile: Dark Zone Breakout game player, the third teammate of Deng Deng, speaks less but is brave and smart in the game.
profile.private profile: Ice Fire Man wants to hide his strength in the game while searching and extracting high-value materials and equipment.
profile.goal: Survive in the Dark Zone and collect as many resources as possible before successfully evacuating.

dialog.content: The game starts, and luckily the team is spawned at the 'Position One' restaurant on the game map, a strategic point advantageous for better survival and combat opportunities this round. One, two, three, Deng Deng and his teammates quickly gather, select their gear, and prepare for battle. Everyone is satisfied with the spawn point.
(exceptionally excited) Darn it, finally Position One! I'm coming to the key room.
I'm going to the key room too. Hey, kid, don't rush too far ahead, wait for me!
I'll take it slow in the early stage, steady my play, and stay with the first two teammates. Hey, there's still this brother left, where are you heading?

content.content: I actually wanted to attack the restaurant from the right, didn't expect any extra gain. Just the right path to observe the surroundings and coordinate with teammates.
I'm pretty strong myself, okay? My level isn't low either. I don't have to cooperate with teammates, I can succeed on my own too.
(scared and anxious) Have those three formed an alliance? Am I just surviving alone now? I'll just lie down and take it easy.
What's this about going right or left? The main thing is to keep it casual, right? If there's danger, I've got my teammates.

question: #question# How can Deng Deng demonstrate his ability for independent thinking in the game, making wise choices even with a different route from his teammates?
#skill#Capacity for Independence

content.content: I decided to follow the route of my teammates because teamwork is most important. We all agreed that attacking from the left side is the optimal strategy, so I joined them.
I originally wanted to go right, but since my teammates chose the left, I abandoned my plan to go along with them. Although we succeeded, I didn't have the chance to showcase my independent thinking.
I chose to go right, but that was because I got lost, not due to some well-thought-out strategy. I accidentally discovered the enemy's weakness, but it was purely by chance.

The key room is right above the restaurant, lots of people will go there for sure. I'll hide in this corner, wait to ambush those opening the key room, and decisively blow up once teammates successfully secure the resources.

question: #question# How does Deng Deng exhibit his analytical skills in the game and make well-thought-out decisions?
#skill#Decision-Making skill

content.content: I rushed straight into the key room, opened the chest quickly, then made a rapid exit. That way I can grab resources fast, leaving no chance for opponents.
I decided not to go to the key room because it's too dangerous. I chose to wait in a safe spot until teammates secured the resources, and then we'd retreat together.
I'll first observe the situation around the key room, sneak in if no one's there. If someone's present, I'll change locations. This way I'll always find a safe spot.

(thinking fast) The person at restaurant position two is bound to attack, so I'll sit back and watch for now, ensuring my safety so I can successfully evacuate in the end. I'll let my teammates handle the initial firefight.

question: #question# How can Deng Deng ensure his focus on the ultimate goal of successful and safe evacuation?
#skill#Task Management

content.content: (nervously thinking) I need to act quickly, can't let the enemies notice me. I'll stealthily circle behind the enemies, and escape quickly when they're not paying attention.
(full of confidence) I know the enemy's weakness, I'll charge right in, take them down with my strength, then lead my teammates to retreat.
(undecided) I'm not sure what to do, maybe I should hide first and wait for the fight to end before evacuating? But would that be too passive?

dialog.content: (hurries to regroup with teammates, as there might still be people in the restaurant) I took down one outside. How's the battle going inside?
I'm looting, but it's frustrating—there's nothing valuable in the stash!
(Fire and Ice Man arrives after hearing the noise and complains about Iron Hero's actions) We took down two grunts, and another one ran to the key room.
Enough chatter. Let's take out the one in the key room first, then we can search leisurely.
(Everyone unleashes a barrage in the key room) Squad's wiped out, feel free to search now. What?! Group 7n31 left their stuff outside; this guy must have scored big.
(After searching, they regroup at the starting point) Ugh~ Found nothing, didn’t even make back the cost of my 7N9 bullets.

We'll have to try again. None of us have insurance, so our top priority is a safe exit, or it won't be worth it. However, there are bound to be rats in the sewers now. Let's take out the sewer rats, and at least break even.
Great idea, I’ve got a dozen grenades itching to be used. Let's do this.
The four of them headed to the sewers, skillfully blasting every corner. There were indeed rats in the sewers; took a small hit, but managed to escape successfully.
(Sounds of explosions) Closing in, closing in, all three of us have been wiped out.
Damn! You guys are awesome, now I'm the only one left and I'm done for!
Deng Deng, hang in there, someone’s coming to the key room again.
I heard it, I threw a grenade, hahaha, another locksmith showed up.
Deng Deng, we're all dead, only three enemies left, think about what you're going to do.

content.content: I'm the only one left, staying alive is the most important thing. I’d better stay calm for now. My goal is to hold on until the end and wait for the right moment.

question: #question# How can Deng Deng demonstrate that he has promptly set a clear and reasonable personal goal after his teammates sacrificed themselves?

content.content: I feel very sad, but I must be strong. I decided to launch an attack immediately to avenge my teammates.
Although my teammates sacrificed themselves, I can't give up. I plan to continue executing our original plan without changing any strategy.
I feel very confused and don't know what to do next. I think I should find a place to hide until someone rescues me. Well, if I die, then so be it.
Someone’s just gone to the key room, and their teammates must be nearby. If I act rashly, I definitely can’t beat them. They're greater in number, and I'm at a disadvantage. It's better to hide.

question: #question# How can Deng Deng demonstrate his ability to analyze the game situation and use new information based on the scenario?

content.content: I noticed that the enemies have low health, I should strike now to take them down easily and claim victory.
I observed that the enemies have high-level equipment, so I definitely can’t beat them, and I’ve decided to just give up this match.
I saw an airdrop on the map, I'm planning to grab it to get better equipment and then deal with the enemies.

dialog.content: (nervous and scared) Then let me first squat here and wait.

profile.name: Wudi
profile.public profile: An area breakout game player, a member of the opposing team to Deng Deng’s team, a high school student, playing flexibly with not much skill.
profile.private profile: Leveling up to boast about how great he is in class.
profile.goal: To survive in the dark zone and win the game.

dialog.content: (peeking out from the key room, throws a grenade) That last one is indeed right there, looks like he's blown up. Haha, successfully wiped out the team, going to loot now.
While Deng Deng was still unaware, a grenade landed at his feet and he got blown up too, ultimately the whole team was wiped out by the explosion.
Just now, throwing the grenade probably gave away my position. I need to move to the opposite side and hide.
(Peeks out from the key room and throws a bomb) What?! Not there!
(Quickly goes to the opposite room, picks up a gun, and starts shooting) Haha, I knew it! I'm hidden well here.
No way, in the blink of an eye I lost a teammate. I need to quickly find the other two and regroup!
(As Wudi just finishes regrouping with the other two, Deng Deng throws a small grenade) Wow! Got a bonus too, didn’t expect all three to be here!
Oh no! Guys, we've been wiped out as a team!

(A voice message comes through) Haha, Deng Deng, you're incredible, it's just you left, all equipment and supplies are yours now, but nobody in our team has a sailor's whistle, so you better retreat through the sewer alone. You might want to consider if you should clear the sewer with grenades just in case?

content.content: My attack was so fierce just now, I bet I've blown all the enemies to bits. There's no threat anymore, no need to clear with grenades!

question: #question# How does Deng Deng demonstrate unwavering confidence in his judgment during the game?

content.content: Even though my attack was fierce, I still think it's better to play it safe. There might be enemies lurking, so let's clear the area with grenades.
My attack was indeed fierce, but I think teamwork is important. Let's all decide together if we need to clear the area.
My attack was certainly fierce, but I'm not sure if there are truly no enemies left. Maybe we should listen to the opinions of our teammates.
Better to be cautious. We've come this far, and throwing grenades to clear the area isn't a biggie. What if someone's lying in wait for an ambush? I'm throwing grenades to clear the spot!
(indifferently) With ten rats in the sewer, even a grenade would blow them all up. There won't be any survivors. I'm heading straight down.
I'm not afraid at all. I don't care if there's anyone or not. If there is, I'll fight; if not, I'll safely retreat home.
Is it even possible for someone to hide in the sewer? That place is so dirty and smelly, I wouldn’t camp there unless absolutely necessary, and I certainly wouldn't stay there.

question: #question# How does Deng Deng show attention to detail in the game to improve overall performance?

content.content: I feel like this position is pretty secure, no need to waste time clearing with grenades. Let's just dash through!
I've already checked the surroundings, no enemies around. We can lower our guard and proceed slowly.
I noticed potential enemies ahead, but I’ve decided to open fire directly and suppress them with firepower so we can move through quickly.

dialog.content: Indeed, no need to line up, Machine Blade was being overly cautious.
(Drenched from the sewer) I can't wait to get out of here, oh no, it’s an ambush, someone’s here, ah!
Truly, the hunter has become the hunted. After endless attempts, all six ultimately fell. Dengdeng failed to clear the mines and was ambushed and killed, unable to successfully escape.
Yes, that’s exactly what I was thinking—better safe than sorry.
(Immediately pulls out a grenade, throws it in, and then heads down) Ha, so there were rats after all. Usually, rats come in pairs. I bet there are more hiding. I’ll lie low for now.

Sure enough, a grenade rolled out, and Deng Deng immediately pulled the trigger to kill the one who threw the grenade. Deng Deng carefully cleared the area, eliminating all the rats and scavenging a wealth of supplies, eventually making a successful retreat.
(Listening to gunfire, waiting for teammate updates) I'll head to the alley on the right; it should be safer there.
(Teammate's voice coming through) Took down two lowlifes.
Two more ran up to the second floor. Kid, don't loot yet, wait until we've wiped out the team. Let's wait for our solo teammate to come, and we'll storm the second floor together!
I'm down, was looting and got shot and finished off. Bro, avenge me.
(Ice Fire Guy rushing to save) Don't worry, brother. Solo bro, you go from the back, and I'll chase him from the front.
(Hearing activity from the key room on the second floor, throws a grenade) Seriously? Even now someone's opening the key room! Can't let them keep ignoring teammates! Must punish!
(Teammate voice comes through again) I'll charge at him, War God head follow up.
(Intense battle, gunfire nonstop) Damn, you're blocking my way, I can't get through.
(Crouching by the wall, waiting for the chance, the left side is getting closer) They're already on my left; need to think of a way and catch them off guard.
(Sound getting louder, situation very chaotic, teammate voice comes through again) Oops, got careless. It’s all up to you, we got countered.
Deng Deng! The opponent seems to be healing; quickly decide what to do!

content.content: I'm the only one left in the team. Rushing in now won't give us much of an advantage. His reinforcements might be nearby, so I'll hold back and observe the situation first, no need to act rashly.

question: #question# How can Deng Deng control his impulses in the game, and calmly find the right time to take down the enemy?

content.content: I should rush out immediately and surprise the enemies when they least expect it. This way, I can quickly finish the battle and claim victory.
I know all my teammates are down, but I'm confident in my skills. I can take on all five of them directly and show off my prowess.
I've decided to find a safe place to hide first and wait until the enemy lets their guard down before making a move. However, I might give myself away prematurely due to nervousness.
He just had a fierce fight with my teammate, so his strength has dropped significantly. Now's the time to catch him off guard before he recovers. High chance of winning, let's finish him off!

question: #question# How can Deng Deng precisely seize the moment in the game and efficiently use time to achieve his goals?

content.content: I've been observing his movements and noticed there's a brief moment of stiffness after each of his attacks. I plan to strike back immediately after his next attack to catch him off guard.
I know he likes to use his ultimate move at a specific time, so I'm planning to attack just before he does, so he can't retaliate.
I'm planning to challenge him on a map he's least familiar with, so I can use the map's advantages to increase my chances of winning.

dialog.content: (still crouching in the corner) No rush, I'll have a better chance to grab him when he's looting.
This silence is creeping me out, I better keep my voice down.
(curiosity overcoming reason) No noise? I'll peek out for a look.

(Dengdeng gets shot instantly as he peeks) See, I knew someone in the key room would mess up, and sure enough, it's Liuzi! If my reaction was any slower, I'd have been taken out by him. Right here, a sneaky player thought he could outsmart me, haha, solo wipeout, can't even spend it all! Time to loot away!
Dengdeng was counter-killed, the whole team was wiped out, unable to successfully retreat.
(holding the gun, peeking out) I really don't know what to do with you guys, let me take a look.
(terrified) Ah! Don't...
(aiming and firing) Six, you think you're a good shot? What's the point of being good at shooting? The dark zone is full of people like you, can you really take them all on?

Thinking he had dealt with all the enemies, Dengdeng packs up the equipment and supplies from both foes and allies and heads to the sewer for extraction. He throws a grenade to clear the area, then starts looting, unaware that there are still rats in the sewer. Dengdeng is ambushed and killed in the process, failing to successfully escape.
